examples: Even in his London shop, the majority of the fishmonger's customers are European.
I go to the fishmonger at like, four o'clock, as late as I could, to get this fish for the bit.

words.defineEn: a cupboard or small room found in people's houses, particularly in the past, in order to store food
words.defineVi: một cái tủ hoặc căn phòng nhỏ được tìm thấy trong nhà của mọi người, đặc biệt là trong quá khứ, để lưu trữ thực phẩm

examples: Male earwigs have curved pincers On females they’re straight.
And then, their pincers are a wholly different set of appendages.
There’s a pair of pincers right at the end.
Usually the bigger one with the bigger pincers sends his opponent running.
And between their spines are pincers called pedicellariae that they use to groom themselves.
words.defineEn: a hand tool for holding consisting of a compound lever for grasping
words.defineVi: một dụng cụ cầm tay để giữ bao gồm một đòn bẩy phức hợp để nắm

examples: These offspring were often seers who could communicate with their jinn relatives as well as with the divine.

words.defineVi: một người có thẩm quyền người bói toán tương lai

examples: This is Ireland, county Limerick.
I like it Hannah: everything's better with a limerick Kati:
words.defineEn: a humorous poem of five anapestic lines with a rhyme scheme of aabba
words.defineVi: một bài thơ hài hước gồm năm dòng anapesic với sơ đồ gieo vần aabba

words.defineEn: a framework erected over an oil well to allow drill tubes to be raised and lowered
words.defineVi: một khung được dựng lên trên một giếng dầu để cho phép các ống khoan được nâng lên và hạ xuống

examples: Endorsed a new maverick.
The system doesn't encourage independent thinkers and mavericks.
What was at his disposal was this great personality and this great sense of humor and this true reformer, maverick spirit.
Because Tom Cruise was cool in Top Gun when he was the Maverick.
It's like the thinnest balance beam that's probably existed, because on one side, he's trying to still retain the, "I'm the independent, I'm the moderate, I can appeal, I'm the maverick."
words.defineEn: an individual who thinks and behaves differently and independently
words.defineVi: một cá nhân suy nghĩ và cư xử khác nhau và độc lập

words.defineEn: the branch of physics concerned with the motion of bodies in a frame of reference

examples: Dr. Erroll Byer is the Chair of Obstetrics and Gynecology.
words.defineEn: the branch of medicine and surgery dealing with pregnancy and childbirth
words.defineVi: ngành y học và phẫu thuật liên quan đến mang thai và sinh nở

examples: But really, even healthy bodies are mosaics.
A mosaic of fingerprints aside, the real issue is on the inside, the software.
By this time, the mosaic of swamps, forests, and grasslands wasn’t really a mosaic any more.
Oh, well, your nipples are going to be square and blocky, fleshy mosaics forever now.
So what did this mosaic of traits mean for Ardi?
words.defineEn: viral disease in solanaceous plants (tomatoes, potatoes, tobacco) resulting in mottling and often shriveling of the leaves
words.defineVi: bệnh do virus ở các cây họ cà (cà chua, khoai tây, thuốc lá) dẫn đến lá có đốm và thường bị khô héo

examples: The State Department had a cattle research center in Front Royal Virginia, an incredibly bucolic farm where their personnel would live out the nuclear war.
Land Rover had an entirely different history making off-road vehicles used by the military and bucolic customers in Europe and around the world starting in 1947.

words.defineEn: excessive desire for money and material goods
words.defineVi: ham muốn quá mức về tiền bạc và của cải vật chất

words.defineEn: a substance for cleaning the teeth; applied with a toothbrush
words.defineVi: một chất để làm sạch răng; áp dụng với một bàn chải đánh răng

examples: Rivalries and prejudice were by degrees fading out.
In her entire career, Monia has stayed a cut above the rest by steering clear of prejudices and letting her work talk for itself.
As a journalist, I believe that fair play is a jewel, and it's important to report the truth without bias or prejudice.
Prejudice is a poison that divides and conquers the people that are engaged in this fear based, antagonistic way of living.
The racial slur in this newsreel title shows the prejudice towards Mexican workers during this time.
words.defineEn: an unreasonable opinion or judgment based on dislike felt for a person, group, etc., particularly because of their race, sex, etc.
words.defineVi: một ý kiến hoặc đánh giá vô lý dựa trên cảm giác không thích đối với một người, một nhóm, v.v., đặc biệt là vì chủng tộc, giới tính của họ, v.v.

examples: I said crevice!
The bellybutton can be a crevice on some people!
It's not a crevice.
Both groups live in the crevices of limestone towers in forests.
The mites crowd together in the crevices - places where the cockroach can’t brush them off.
words.defineEn: a long narrow depression in a surface
words.defineVi: một trầm cảm hẹp dài trong một bề mặt

examples: They made my quest for marsupial orifices possible.

examples: He is not a novice at all.
It was a total novice move.
In one study, a group of 20 novice meditators participated in a 10-day intensive workshop.
And some research suggests that really novice students might benefit from having a more structured learning environment rather than the freedom to solve problems on their own.
Studies have shown that, especially for novice echolocators (like me), moving the head around helps us understand the shape of the space around them.
words.defineEn: a person who is new and inexperienced in a position
words.defineVi: một người mới và thiếu kinh nghiệm trong một vị trí
